title: Can't log in
body: After attempting log in for a few moment I get an "Unknown error" message that assures me that a report has been sent to the server. Any ideas?

replies.body:
Typically, I will notice my champion not move, or perform an action when I command it, or, since I frequently jungle, a jungle camp appearing empty when I am pretty sure it should be occupied by monsters, at which point I will look to my ping in the upper right side of the screen and find pings anywhere from 100 to 500+ (in the case of the empty jungle camps, the monsters will typically appear after a second or so, while the ping may take longer to settle, excepting of course when I've been counter-jungled, in which case I have other problems on my hands. :) Quite typically, the lag only lasts a second or two, with the longest periods of lag only lasting maybe 4-5 seconds, before my ping drops back to the normal 65 or so that I typically see in play. I also occasionally notice the same during the loading screen, with the ping suddenly spiking to 500+ for a second or two while sitting in loading screen, once again, not obviously correlating to whether I am still loading, or sitting at 100%, waiting for others to load. This, it seems to me, pretty well precludes display issues, but I'll let you be the judge of relevance here. 

As far as the many changes/adjustments I've made to my system, which I briefly mentioned in the last post, they seem to have had negligible affects on this intermittent severe lag, but provided noticeable improvement in ridding my experience of FPS drops in team-fights, etc., and are part of the sacrifice that I make in playing the game on this laptop. I am o the point now, that excepting these seemingly random lag-spikes, my playing experience is pretty decent, with only very occasional slight FPS drops in crazy team-fight situations, which I can live with, and if nothing else, provide me a ready excuse should I miss my smite steal of baron, etc.  

The computer I am playing on is an:

HP Pavilion dv4 Notebook PC
Intel Core i5-3210M CPU @ 2.50GHz
64 bit Windows 7 Home Premium Service Pack 1
4 GB Ram

Running an NVidia GEFORCE GT 630M with 2GB ram


I hope this information is useful to you in the search for an identification, and hopefully, a resolution of this problem. If there is any other information I can provide that may be of use to you, let me know, and for a nominal fee, or if you ask nicely, (: I will be happy to oblige.

Thanks.

Are you still having this issue? There was an issue going on with Comcast routing to the login service, but it should be resolved by now as far as we've heard.

Please let me know.

>
> Are you still having this issue? There was an issue going on with Comcast routing to the login service, but it should be resolved by now as far as we've heard.
> 
> Please let me know.

Targons Blade,

I am once again able to log in. Thank you for the prompt service. It is greatly appreciated.

Perhaps you could help me with one other item: I have occasional severe lag issues in-game that seem mostly to be random, ie., they occur at random times throughout the game, rather than specifically during team-fights, or other moments of increased graphics, or other taxations on my system.

I am not playing on a high-end machine and understand that a certain amount of the lag issues may be local to my machine. With that in mind, I have turned down all the in-game graphics settings to the minimum, and have tweaked all my system's settings to minimalist, even going so far as reducing my refresh rate to 40hz through Intel's graphics settings on my machine. 

All these adjustments (and more) have resulted in a slight overall improvement in performance, yet I still have these intermittent severe lag issues. Numerous times when they have occurred, I analyzed my system immediately, and found no background processes running, or even a spike in memory usage or computing usage. So, I was wondering if some of the issues may have to do with Comcast's routing to Riot, and if that is the case, if there is any hope of a fix for this any time soon. 

Some quick Google searches of the keywords of "League of Legends" and "Comcast" suggest that per-say "Comcast lag" has been an issue in times past, with symptoms similar to mine. I also found a suggestion that changing my network adapter driver to the older Windows XP version might help, but found that people that did so gernerally did not find any real improvement, but have no yet tried this myself.

Sorry for the long post, but really, I am wondering if there is anything additional remedy that you may know of that I may try in order to fix this issue myself, or if it is a known issue and I am stuck waiting for a resolution.

Again, many thanks for your prompt assistance and the quick resolution to the login problem.

-Aaron

Thanks for giving me a detailed description of what you've already tried to resolve this specific issue, it really does help me decide what steps we can skip. One thing I'm not able to determine is whether you're experiencing FPS drops or latency spikes when the "lag" occurs. If you could dive into a bit more specifics around what specific behavior you experience when the issue happens, I can determine whether this is a connection or display issue.
